revised_title: Revolutionizing Medical Diagnosis: The E.M.I. Scanner and its Impact on Healthcare
tldr: The E.M.I. scanner, a machine that employs computerized tomography, allows for the differentiation and measurement of soft tissues' density, overcoming limitations of conventional X-ray technology. By scanning through the patient in a transaxial plane, the E.M.I. scanner provides a series of tomographic slices, offering a more accurate and detailed view of the body's interior, improving diagnosis and disease detection.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Medical Imaging
